alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Gila; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 19 at 5:31PM MST until July 19 at 8:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Gila County in east central Arizona... Coconino County in north central Arizona... Navajo County in north central Arizona... * Until 830 PM MST. * At 526 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across rural portions of extreme southeast Coconino, northeast Gila, and southwest Navajo counties. Between 1 and 2.25 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fort Apache Reservation. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Crouch Creek, Ellison Creek, Gentry Creek, Canyon Creek, Pine Creek, Oak Creek, Chevelon Canyon, Bear Creek, Cherry Creek, Rock House Creek, Mule Creek, Willow Creek, Haigler Creek, Rock Creek and Sloan Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
